metadata.title: CVE-2023-6176 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
A null pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernel API for thecryptographic algorithm scatterwalk functionality. This issue occurs when auser constructs a malicious packet with specific socket configuration,which could allow a local user to crash the system or escalate theirprivileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6176` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-39-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1

No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required
